review: I purchased this during the $20 promo - why wouldn't you want to try it for such a great price? We got rid of the cable box in the bedroom in anticipation of receiving this and it was such a great decision. It does have limited apps compared to the Roku which we gifted to a family member last Christmas, but maybe Amazon will expand the app selection?? I'll love the music channels to listen to while getting ready without using my phone and wasting the battery. I give 4 stars because the remote is not designed well. I don't get the circular design of the top button, it sometimes clicks the wrong direction if you don't hit it right on the edge of the direction you want. You have to really push hard on the buttons and the feed from the remote to the tv is slow - we've clicked a few times and nothing was received on the tv and then all of the sudden it scrolls uncontrollably to catch up to the amount of times you pressed the button to navigate. The cord to plug into the wall is VERY short so depending on where the tv is located in comparison to the outlet, you may need to use an extension cord. For PRIME folks, it is a must get. For the $20 promo price, it's a nice device to have and it'll save us a few bucks a month without having the extra cable box!
author: Vickielacie

review: I am very unsatisfied with my Fire TV Stick. I primarily use Netflix and Bloomberg TV, but find myself unable to keep a connection. I have a strong wi-fi connection to the Stick, but it keeps freezing and forcing me back to the network settings. I have other devices in close proximately to this device that are operating with wireless without an issue. When the connectivity problem occurs the device is unable to find any wi-fi in the area (neighbors, etc.). These other wi-fi connections show up when the device is functioning properly, so it leads me to believe the device is faulty and not every router in the neighborhood at the very same instant.To solve the connectivity problem, I find myself "hard restarting" the device (hold middle button and Play/Pause) at least once a day to re-connect through the power cycle. It's just a quick to sit through the start-up of an Xbox or Apple TV.A wonderful idea that I thought would be the icing on the cake to convince me to subscribe to Amazon Prime, but I think I am better off without.
